trans-unit.source: Learn and create Message Maps and Transforms
trans-unit.target: Learn and create Message Maps and Transforms

trans-unit.source: <token>transform</token>s in <legacyBold><token>af_integration_full</token></legacyBold> are designed to manipulate data.
trans-unit.target: <token>transform</token>s in <legacyBold><token>af_integration_full</token></legacyBold> are designed to manipulate data.

trans-unit.source: Consider the following scenario:
trans-unit.target: Consider the following scenario:

trans-unit.source: An incoming message contains customer data, including First Name, Last Name, Street Address, City, State, and Zip Code.
trans-unit.target: An incoming message contains customer data, including First Name, Last Name, Street Address, City, State, and Zip Code.

trans-unit.source: When this data is received, you want to manipulate the data.
trans-unit.target: When this data is received, you want to manipulate the data.

trans-unit.source: For example, you want to combine First Name and Last Name into a single Name value.
trans-unit.target: For example, you want to combine First Name and Last Name into a single Name value.

trans-unit.source: <token>af_integration_full</token> is your answer.
trans-unit.target: <token>af_integration_full</token> is your answer.

trans-unit.source: Using a <token>transform</token>, the incoming message data can be manipulated to the desired output.
trans-unit.target: Using a <token>transform</token>, the incoming message data can be manipulated to the desired output.

trans-unit.source: Benefits
trans-unit.target: Benefits

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>XSLT Support</legacyBold>: You can:
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>XSLT Support</legacyBold>: You can:

trans-unit.source: Import an .xslt or .xsl file or directly enter XSLT syntax
trans-unit.target: Import an .xslt or .xsl file or directly enter XSLT syntax

trans-unit.source: Import an XML extension file or directly enter XML syntax
trans-unit.target: Import an XML extension file or directly enter XML syntax

trans-unit.source: Use the XslCompiledTransform property for better performance
trans-unit.target: Use the XslCompiledTransform property for better performance

trans-unit.source: Use XSLT in every Transform file (.trfm)
trans-unit.target: Use XSLT in every Transform file (.trfm)

trans-unit.source: When XSLT is used, the <token>transform</token> design area is grayed out.
trans-unit.target: When XSLT is used, the <token>transform</token> design area is grayed out.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Built-in <token>mapop</token>s</legacyBold>: Many <token>transform</token> scenarios are handled by the built-in <token>mapop</token>s, including string manipulation, looping with set scope, expressions, list functionality, Date/Time, CSharp scripting, and so on.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Built-in <token>mapop</token>s</legacyBold>: Many <token>transform</token> scenarios are handled by the built-in <token>mapop</token>s, including string manipulation, looping with set scope, expressions, list functionality, Date/Time, CSharp scripting, and so on.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>xs:extension and xs:restriction</legacyBold>: Use complex types in your schemas.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>xs:extension and xs:restriction</legacyBold>: Use complex types in your schemas.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Choose your project</legacyBold>: In <token>vsprvs</token>, you can create a new <token>transform</token> in its own project (<ui>BizTalk Service Artifacts</ui>) or create a new <token>transform</token> in a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Choose your project</legacyBold>: In <token>vsprvs</token>, you can create a new <token>transform</token> in its own project (<ui>BizTalk Service Artifacts</ui>) or create a new <token>transform</token> in a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: When created in its own project, a <token>transform</token> can be added to an X12 agreement between EDI partners.
trans-unit.target: When created in its own project, a <token>transform</token> can be added to an X12 agreement between EDI partners.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Add the <token>transform</token> to a <token>bridge</token></legacyBold>: After a <token>transform</token> is created, the <token>transform</token> can be added to the <token>transform</token> stage within a <token>one-way</token> or a <token>request_response</token>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Add the <token>transform</token> to a <token>bridge</token></legacyBold>: After a <token>transform</token> is created, the <token>transform</token> can be added to the <token>transform</token> stage within a <token>one-way</token> or a <token>request_response</token>.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="45edc54c-7910-46dd-bc35-7e954dd1cf94" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configure an XML One-Way Bridge</link> and <link xlink:href="7e5fedb4-9ab1-4470-aa8a-204633391da7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an XML Request-Reply Bridge</link> lists the steps.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="45edc54c-7910-46dd-bc35-7e954dd1cf94" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configure an XML One-Way Bridge</link> and <link xlink:href="7e5fedb4-9ab1-4470-aa8a-204633391da7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create an XML Request-Reply Bridge</link> lists the steps.

trans-unit.source: Get Started
trans-unit.target: Get Started
